posts.title: Resistor Codes
posts.text: Color Coding If your resistor’s marking looks like above picture, it’s using color codes.To read more or calculate it’s value, click Color Codes Marking for Resistor. RKM Coding If your resistor’s marking looks like above picture, the resistor’s value can be determined by RMK codes.To read more, click RMK Marking for Resistor. 3-Digit Coding 4-Digit Coding EIA E96 Coding If your resistor’s marking looks like above picture , it’s using E-96 codes.To read more info or calculate it’s value, click EIA E96 Coding for Resistor.

posts.title: Color Codes Marking for Resistor
posts.text: window.onload=function(){ init_color_bands("#colorbands","#bandsresult"); show_e96_table("#color-code"); } Want to know how it works? Read this. Calculator: Tables Examples Examples of resistance values 4.7Ω ±20% 56.0Ω ±5% 270Ω ±5% 130Ω ±1% See Also:Resistor Codes Preferred number series for resistors and capacitors(IEC60063)

posts.title: RMK Marking for Resistor
posts.text: In RKM code system, the resistor’s value is marked by 3 or 4 digits and a letter L,R,K,M or G. The letter is used as a multiplier and a decimal separator.For example, 5K6 indicates a resistor value of 5.6 kΩ(5.6×1000=5.6k).For detailed description you can read this. Tables Code letterMultiplier L×0.001 R×1 K×1000 M×1000000 G×1000000000 Examples Examples of resistance values R470.47Ω 4R74.7Ω 470R470Ω 4K74.7kΩ 47K47kΩ 47K347.3kΩ 470K470kΩ See Also:Resistor Codes Preferred number series for resistors and capacitors(IEC60063)

posts.title: EIA E96 Coding for Resistor
posts.text: EIA E96 Coding is used for 1% precision 0603 resistors.It starts with two-digit code followed by a letter multiplier. Each letter, from “A” — “Z”, represents a specific multiplier.For example, 68X indicates a resistor value of 49.9Ω.The two-digit code refers to one of the E96 series numbers.The standard IEC60062 gives a good explanation for it. Calculator window.onload=function(){ show_e96_code_table("#e96-code"); show_e96_multiplier_table("#e96-multiplier"); } Input a value here: (For example, 68X) Please input a value to get the result! Tablescode multiplier Examples Examples of resistance values 68A499Ω 68B4.99kΩ 68C49.9kΩ 68D499kΩ 68E4.99MΩ 68F49.9MΩ 68X49.9Ω 68Y4.99Ω 68Z0.499Ω See Also:Resistor Codes Preferred number series for resistors and capacitors(IEC60063)

posts.title: Preferred number series for resistors and capacitors(IEC60063)
posts.text: Number series listSelect a series: E3 E6 E12 E24 E48 E96 E192 Please select a series to show the data! Find the nearst valueInput a value here: Please input a value to get the data! RecommendationFor Resistor Tolerance %E series Wider than ±20%E3 ±20%E6 ±10%E12 ±5%E24 ±2%E48 ±1%E96(Some vendors provide E24+E96) Tighter than ±1%E192(Some vendors provide E24+E192) For CapactiorThe E series like E48 or above are typically not applied, and therefor the tightest tolerance of 1% is used with values of E24 series. See Also:E series of preferred numbers–wikipedia.
